intro: Galium corrudifolium var. mauritii, commonly known as the Mauritius bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale green flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
